description: From Middle English sacre, from Middle French sacre, from Old Spanish sacro, from Arabic صَقْر‎ (ṣaqr).

entries.meaning: A falcon (Falco cherrug) native of Southern Europe and Asia.
A medium cannon slightly smaller than a culverin developed during the early 17th century.
examples: This place of strength vvas furnished of sixe great peeces, demi-Culuerins, and Sakers, vvhich shot directlie in front vpon vs as vve approched.
